Original_Text: NEW YORK (Reuters) - The dollar weakened against the euro on Monday as investors awaited key U.S. employment data, signaling caution amid rising oil prices.
SAN FRANCISCO (AP) - A major tech firm announced a 20 percent cut in its workforce, citing increased competition and declining demand for its cloud services.
LONDON (AFP) - Britain's largest retailer reported a 15 percent drop in quarterly profits due to aggressive price cuts and supply chain disruptions.
TOKYO (Reuters) - Japan's Nikkei index climbed 1.2 percent as tech stocks rallied following positive earnings from a leading semiconductor manufacturer.
HONG KONG - A Chinese e-commerce giant acquired a Southeast Asian startup for $1.5 billion, aiming to expand its digital payment platform.
PARIS (Reuters) - European regulators fined a pharmaceutical company $300 million for misleading marketing of a new diabetes drug.
SYDNEY (Dow Jones) - Australia's mining sector faced a downturn as global commodity prices fell, impacting major exporters.
BEIJING (AFP) - China's government introduced new tariffs on imported electronics, escalating trade tensions with the U.S.
CHICAGO (Reuters) - A major airline reduced its flight schedule by 10 percent, citing high fuel costs and lower passenger demand.
MUMBAI - India's central bank raised interest rates to curb inflation, prompting concerns about slowing economic growth.
